newsitem.title: GREECE: ATHLETICS-AMERICANS CRASH OUT OF 4X100 MEN'S RELAY.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-AMERICANS CRASH OUT OF 4X100 MEN'S RELAY.

text.p: The U.S. 4X100 metres men's relay quartet team crashed out of the heats on Saturday for the second world championships in a row.
The first baton change between Brian Lewis and Tim Montgomery went badly wrong when Montgomery seemed to take off from his mark early and Lewis was unable to catch him and hand over the baton.
Lewis eventually had to turn round, the pair bumped into each other and they both left track in disgust.
Two years ago Jon Drummond and Tony McCall made a similar mess of the change on the second leg of the qualifying round.
Prior to the 1995 Gothenburg championships the United States had won each of the four world finals.
